DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: This page contains brief information about iobenguane I 131 and a collection of links to more information about the use of this drug, research results, and ongoing clinical trials.
DrugInfoMetaData.FDAExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Para.ExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Iobenguane I 131 is approved to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Pheochromocytoma or paraganglioma that is malignant and requires systemic anticancer therapy. It is used in adults and children aged 12 years or older whose iobenguane scan was positive and whose disease is locally advanced, has spread to other parts of the body, or cannot be removed by surgery.

Section.Para: Iobenguane I 131 is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Section.Title: Clinical Trials Accepting Patients
Section.Para: Find Clinical Trials for Iobenguane I-131 - Check for trials from NCI's list of cancer clinical trials now accepting patients.

DrugInfoDisclaimer.Para: Important: The drug information on this page is meant to be educational. It is not a substitute for medical advice. The information may not cover all possible uses, actions, interactions, or side effects of this drug, or precautions to be taken while using it. Please see your health care professional for more information about your specific medical condition and the use of this drug.
